tweets.text: @cynicalkind @NigelSarbutts @GarethDennis @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding Can somebody please intervene and explain in very simple terms how Chris does not discuss HS2 as a mode of transport, how it functions, etc, but talks about the wildlife falling victim to construction along the line, as he does with other wildlife-endangering projects.

Breaking News . @EnvAgency have sanctioned the destruction of breeding birds tomorrow at the Lower Otter Restoration Project . This is #HS2 part 2 . PLEASE THINK AGAIN @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest Please follow @WiseBirding and RT https://t.co/I8Wv40YKqy

@scottdegg @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @RedIndustries2 @PHE_uk @StinkStopthe I listened closely to the words of @ClareDinnisEA during her Radio Stoke interview on Friday. The key point I picked up is future scrutiny of what is being tipped in the landfill. When asked if that meant unlicensed waste has been put in there she didn‚Äôt give a straight answer!
@davemh72 @HCoppins @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @PHE_uk Yeah I remember her saying that but I still don‚Äôt buy it
@poppers82 @HCoppins @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @PHE_uk Apparently it's blue filter cake or something and alledgelly harmless .

@HCoppins @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @PHE_uk Dread to think but the Lyme brook always seems to have a blue tinge that varies in brightness. Makes you really wonder what the hell is going into this monstrosity of a s**t heap

@EmBeck2015 @NigelSarbutts @GarethDennis @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding So #hs2 has nothing to do with transport. Really? So why include it in his tweet? To get attention, to vent his spleen about it yet again? FTR I have no vested interest in HS2. I‚Äôm more concerned about your opposition.

One of many suffering migraines or worsening migraines attributed to landfill gas exposure-the town is dying @MattHancock @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK Take over management of this from the Anti-EA @EnvAgency @Cap_it_off #stopthestink https://t.co/YdAnsk6ote

tweets.text:
@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA 
@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk what is that blue stuff that is being added to the landfill? More chemicals? The blue dust cloud from it might have been a pretty sight but what is it that we are being exposed to now??

@SianieRoo @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA Exactly. If the environment agency sorted it out we‚Äôd happily leave them alone to sit in their office doing nothing waiting for their golden pension.

A long way to go with capping @ClareDinnisEA &still no comment from @EnvAgency re the deadline of 30/4/21. Why is no one working on this yet there‚Äôs time to tip? Profit over people time&time again @Cap_it_off #stopthestink https://t.co/z8W9FKeCyn

Crayfish plague has had a devastating impact on native white clawed crayfish populations across Yorkshire. For more info about threats faced and and what you can do: https://t.co/nPTU3qOJoM @EnvAgencyYNE
I am hearing that @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @NESouthWest may have finally seen sense!? @ChrisGPackham @Natures_Voice @DevonWildlife https://t.co/fAB6uuBlCW

@realevilbus @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency scoffed when reports of it spreading to Stoke on Trent came out. Now regularly hear of yet more afflicted areas. Try listening to your communities next time @JamesBevanEA We are normal people minding our own business- if we complain it‚Äôs for good reason
It never ends does it? The relentless morale-beating that comes from living in a country with an environmental protection body as broken as the @EnvAgency https://t.co/K2Ub0hL4vc
Photo from today. Capping still unfinished. @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids Don't try to tell us they did it on time, we have eyes. https://t.co/6HwgiXw9hB

@BBCNews @GMB @itvnews @Channel4 @piersmorgan @GBNEWS Are you aware that the chairman former CEO and founder of @RedIndustries2 was sent to jail for hacking the phones of the @EnvAgency and others? Surely he wouldn't pass the @EnvAgency fit and proper person test? https://t.co/P9xVIM2jdU

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
